How busy are you? Please choose the band that suits you best:
How much equipment do you have? Please choose the band that suits you best:

Focus areas: 
 
 - Biceps (Short Head) 
 - Forearms

Name:
 • Bicep Curls

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells

 Focus area:
 • Biceps 

 Preparation:
 • Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
 • Keep your back straight and core engaged (tensed).

 Key Tips:
 • Start with a weight that challenges you but allows for proper form.
 • Keep your elbows close to your body.
 • Control the movement, focusing on the contraction of the biceps.

Name:
 • Hammer Curls

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells

 Focus area:
 • Biceps 

 Preparation:
 • Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
 • Keep your back straight and core engaged (tensed).
 • Similar to bicep curls but with palms facing inwards (neutral grip). 

 Key Tips:
 • Start with a weight that challenges you but allows for proper form.
 • Keep your elbows close to your body.
 • Control the movement, focusing on the contraction of the biceps.
 • Engages both the biceps and brachialis.
 • Maintain a controlled pace and avoid swinging.

Name:
 • Dumbbell Rows

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbell, Bench

 Focus area:
 • Back (especially lats) 

 Preparation:
 • Bent over with one knee and hand on a bench, opposite leg on the floor. 
 • Hold a dumbbell in the free hand, hanging straight down. 

 Key Tips:
 • Pull the dumbbell towards your hip, squeezing your shoulder blade. 
 • Keep your back flat and avoid using momentum.

Name:
 • T Bar Rows 

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells

 Focus area:
 • Middle and upper back 

 Preparation:
 • Use a T Bar row machine or landmine attachment. 
 • Load the appropriate weight on one end. 

 Key Tips:
 • Keep your back straight and chest up. 
 • Pull the weight towards your chest, engaging your back muscles.

Name:
 • Cable Machine Rows 

 Equipment:
 • Cable Machine with Straight or V-Bar Attachment 

 Focus area:
 • Upper back 

 Preparation:
 • Use a cable machine with a straight or V-bar attachment. 
 • Keep core braced, and keep back straight. Breathe through nose. 
 • Sit with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the handle, lean slightly forward. 

 Key Tips:
 • Pull the handle towards your lower chest while keeping a straight back. 
 • Control the movement, and avoid excessive leaning. 
 • Hold for a second when touching lower chest.

Name:
 • Lat Pulldown 

 Equipment:
 • Lat Pulldown Machine with Wide Grip Bar 

 Focus area:
 • Latissimus Dorsi (Lats) 

 Preparation:
 • Sit at a lat pulldown machine with a wide grip bar. 
 • Adjust the knee pads for stability. 

 Key Tips:
 • Pull the bar down to the upper chest, engaging the lats. 
 • Control the movement both on the way down and up.

Name:
 • Plate Loaded Arm Rows 

 Equipment:
 • Plate-Loaded Row Machine 

 Focus area:
 • Upper back 

 Preparation:
 • Use a plate-loaded row machine. 
 • Sit with your chest against the pad, grasp the handles. 

 Key Tips:
 • Pull the handles towards you, keeping your chest against the pad. 
 • Focus on squeezing your back muscles at the top of the movement.

Name:
 • Incline Plate Bench 

 Equipment:
 • Incline Bench / Smith Machine / Plate Loaded Incline Press, Plates 

 Focus area:
 • Upper Chest 

 Preparation:
 • Set up an incline bench at a 15-30 degree angle. 
 • Hold the bar, arms extended over your chest. 

 Key Tips:
 • Control the descent and push the plates back up. 
 • Engage the upper chest muscles.

Name:
 • Regular Plate Bench 

 Equipment:
 • Flat Bench / Smith Machine / Plate Loaded Bench Press, Plates 

 Focus area:
 • General Chest 

 Preparation:
 • Lie on a flat bench with a bar. 

 Key Tips:
 • Lower the plates to chest level and push them back up. 
 • Ensure a stable grip and engage your chest muscles and tense your core. 
 • Drive your feet into the floor, have a slight arch in your back. 
 • Push yourself away from the bar. Keep your wrists straight.

Name:
 • Dumbbell Shoulder Press 

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells

 Focus area:
 • Shoulders 

 Preparation:
 • Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. 

 Key Tips:
 • Press the dumbbells overhead, fully extending your arms. 
 • Keep your core engaged and maintain a neutral spine. 
 • Drive your feet into the floor. 
 • Keep elbows at a 45 degree angle

Name:
 • Cable Tricep Pushdown 

 Equipment:
 • Cable Machine with Straight Bar or Rope attachment. 

 Focus area:
 • Triceps 

 Preparation:
 • Use a cable machine with a straight bar or rope attachment. 
 • Raise the pulley point 2 points over head position. 
 • Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, elbows by your sides. 

 Key Tips:
 • Push the bar down, fully extending your elbows. 
 • Control the movement and avoid using momentum. 
 • Brace core, tense triceps when extended. Hold for 1 second before going up.

Name:
 • Overhead Rope Extension 

 Equipment:
 • Cable Machine with Rope attachment. 

 Focus area:
 • Triceps 

 Preparation:
 • Use a cable machine with a rope attachment. • Hold the rope with both hands, starting with it behind your head. 
 • Raise the pulley point 2 points over head position. 
 • Stand facing away from the machine. 

 Key Tips:
 • Extend your arms overhead, focusing on the triceps. 
 • Keep your elbows in a stable position.

Name:
 • Lateral Raises 

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells 

 Focus area:
 • Shoulders 

 Preparation:
 • Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, by your sides. 

 Key Tips:
 • Lift the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. • Control the movement and avoid using excessive weight.

Name:
 • Hack Squat 

 Equipment:
 • Hack Squat Machine 

 Focus area:
 • Quads, Glutes, Hamstrings 

 Preparation:
 • Use a hack squat machine, position your back against the pad. 
 • If desired, you can also face towards the pad to train quads more. 

 Key Tips:
 • Take a deep breath and brace your core, your stomach should be inflated. 
 • Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your back against the pad. 
 • Press through your heels to return to the starting position.

Name:
 • Leg Press 

 Equipment:
 • Leg Press Machine 

 Focus area:
 • Quads, Glutes, Hamstrings 

 Preparation:
 • Sit in a leg press machine, placing your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. 
 • If there feet are higher, more focus on quads. 
 • If feet are lower, more focus on glutes. 

 Key Tips:
 • Push the platform away by extending your knees. 
 • Control the descent and engage your leg muscles.

Name:
 • Romanian Deadlift 

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells / Kettlebell / Barbell 

 Focus area:
 • Hamstrings, glutes, lower back 

 Preparation:
 • Stand with equipment in front of you, feet hip-width apart. 

 Key Tips:
 • Hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight. 
 • Lower the barbell towards the floor while maintaining a slight bend in your knees.

Name:
 • Goblet Squat 

 Equipment:
 • Dumbbells / Kettlebell 

 Focus area:
 • Quads, glutes, hamstrings 

 Preparation:
 • Stand with equipment vertically at chest height. 

 Key Tips:
 • Squat down, keeping your back straight and chest up. 
 • Engage your core and push through your heels to return to the starting position.

Name:
 • Leg Extension 

 Equipment:
 • Leg Extension Machine 

 Focus area:
 • Quads 

 Preparation:
 • Use a leg extension machine, sitting with your knees bent at 90 degrees. 

 Key Tips:
 • Extend your legs, lifting the weight with your quads. 
 • Control the movement, avoiding locking your knees at the top.

Name:
 • Leg Curl 

 Equipment:
 • Leg Curl Machine 

 Focus area:
 • Hamstrings, Quads 

 Preparation:
 • Use a leg curl machine, lying face down with your ankles under the roller pads. 

 Key Tips:
 • Curl the weight towards your glutes, engaging your hamstrings. 
 • Control the movement and avoid arching your back.
